contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=October 2011}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Ian Russell | fullname = Ian Russell | image = IanRussel.jpg | image_size = 250 | caption = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1975|8|30}} | birth_place = [[Seattle, Washington|Seattle]], [[Washington (U.S. state)|WA]], [[United States]] | height = {{height|ft=5|in=10}} | position = [[Midfielder]] | youthyears1 = 1994-97 | youthclubs1 = [[University of Washington|Washington]] | years1 = 1998-99 | years2 = 2000-05 | years3 = 2007 | clubs1 = [[Seattle Sounders (USL)|Seattle Sounders]] | clubs2 = [[San Jose Earthquakes]] | clubs3 = [[Los Angeles Galaxy]] | caps1 = 38 | caps2 = 131 | caps3 = 3 | goals1 = 16 | goals2 = 5 | goals3 = 0 | manageryears1 = 2008- | managerclubs1 = [[San Jose Earthquakes]] ''(Assistant Coach)'' | pcupdate = 13 April 2007 | ntupdate = 9 April 2007 }} '''Ian Russell''' (born August 30, 1975 in [[Seattle, Washington]]) is an [[United States|American]] soccer player and coach. Russell attended the [[University of Washington]] on a soccer scholarship and was a three-time (1995–97) All-Mountain Pacific Sports Federation first team selection.{{citation needed|date=October 2011}} He then played for the [[Seattle Sounders (USL)|Seattle Sounders]] of the [[USL First Division]] in 1998 and 1999. He won the offensive MVP award in 1999.{{citation needed|date=October 2011}} After being drafted from the Seattle Sounders in 2000, Russell played for seven seasons in [[Major League Soccer]]. Six of those seasons were with the [[San Jose Earthquakes]]; Russell appeared in 131 games. A pacy [[midfielder]], he scored five goals and 20 assists, helping the Quakes win two [[MLS Cup]]s, in 2001 and 2003. He is ninth all-time in Quakes history in assists and is tied for first in club history in playoff appearances with 14. His best season with San Jose came in 2001, when he scored three goals and nine assists, while starting all 26 regular season games and all six playoffs games. Russell also played three games in 2007 with the [[Los Angeles Galaxy]], under the management of [[Frank Yallop]]. Russell began coaching while playing for the Seattle Sounders and has continued coaching in the Bay Area, including running camps and directing training sessions for numerous youth teams in the South Bay. Russell returned to the [[San Jose Earthquakes]] in 2008, as assistant coach.<ref>[http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2007/soccer/11/28/quakes.russell/ Quakes hire Russell as assistant]</ref> During his first year with the club, Russell helped the team make a very successful return to MLS. This included the team's posting the best record for any expansion team since 1998 with eight wins, 33 points and 32 goals scored. The Quakes also posted a nine-game unbeaten streak from July 12-Sept. 27, which was the longest unbeaten streak in the league in 2008 and the second longest ever by an expansion team. In the offseason, Russell successfully completed the [[United States Soccer Federation|U.S. Soccer Federation]] "A" coaching license course. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{San Jose Earthquakes squad}} {{Persondata | NAME =Russell, Ian | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION =American soccer player-coach | DATE OF BIRTH =1975-08-30 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Seattle, Washington]], United States | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Russell, Ian}} [[Category:1975 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American soccer coaches]] [[Category:American soccer players]] [[Category:San Jose Earthquakes players]] [[Category:Los Angeles Galaxy players]] [[Category:Seattle Sounders (1994–2008) players]] [[Category:USL A-League players]] [[Category:Major League Soccer players]] [[Category:Washington Huskies men's soccer players]] [[Category:Soccer players from Washington (state)]] [[Category:San Jose Earthquakes draft picks]]
